extensions.name: Background
extensions.description: Creates a background for widgets. The properties are used to create the style of the widgets. The methods are used when the widgets have already been created.

methods.name: BuildProps
methods.description: Returns a new property set containing the previously defined properties.

methods.name: Build
methods.description: Returns a new set of properties configured to set only the color.

methods.name: SetColor
methods.description: Changes the background color of the widget.

methods.name: SetTintColor
methods.description:
Applies a color to the background.
**Info:**
>Unlike the SetColor method, this one will apply a color over the entire background, including the edges.

methods.name: SetColors
methods.description:
Changes the background colors.
**Info:**
>Like the Colors property, it needs a list of Text (HTML Colors) or Colors.

methods.name: SetStroke
methods.description: Changes the borders of the background.

methods.name: SetFileSource
methods.description:
Changes the background image.
**Info:**
>Unlike the corresponding property, this method does accept URLs.

properties.name: Color
properties.description:
Sets the background color.
**Block Types:** *Write*
**Presentation:** *Blocks*

properties.name: Colors
properties.description:
Sets the background colors.
**Block Types:** *Write*
**Presentation:** *Blocks*
**Info:**
>This property sets a gradient as the background.
>The items in the list are colors, Text and Colors are supported.

properties.name: BorderWidth
properties.description:
Sets the thickness of the background edges.
**Block Types:** *Write*
**Presentation:** *Blocks*

properties.name: RippleColor
properties.description:
Sets the color of the wave that is activated when the widget is pressed.
**Block Types:** *Write*
**Presentation:** *Blocks*
**Info:**
>For the wave effect to show, the widget needs to be clickable.

properties.name: BorderColor
properties.description:
Sets the color of the background borders.
**Block Types:** *Write*
**Presentation:** *Blocks*

properties.name: BorderRadius
properties.description:
Sets the radius of the corners of the bottom.
**Block Types:** *Write*
**Presentation:** *Blocks*

properties.name: GradientDirection
properties.description:
Sets the direction of the gradient.
**Block Types:** *Write*
**Presentation:** *Blocks*
**Info:**
>The values ​​are obtained from the property blocks.

properties.name: FileSource
properties.description:
Sets the image to be displayed in the background.
**Block Types:** *Write*
**Presentation:** *Blocks*
**Info:**
>The text should be a path to a file or the name of a file found in the assets of the project.
>If this block is used, all other properties will be ignored to only display the image.
>Supports NinePatch images.

extensions.name: Dynamic RecyclerView (Documentation)
extensions.description:
Documentation for DynamicRecyclerView.



*For all blocks, **\*(asterisk)** means the result type of that block*

methods.name: Build
methods.description: This block allows you to initialize the component with the specified data list.

methods.name: CanScrollHorizontally
methods.description: Returns whether the component can scroll horizontally to the indicated side.

methods.name: CanScrollVertically
methods.description: Returns whether the component can scroll vertically to the indicated side.

methods.name: Create
methods.description: Create a new instance of RecyclerView with a specific size.

methods.name: CreateGridManager
methods.description:
Create and return a new GridLayoutManager instance, which will allow us to display the RecyclerView as a Grid layout

**spanCount:** Number of columns (when it is vertical) or rows (horizontal)

**stackFromEnd** will specify whether the RecyclerView is going to take the bottom side as starting.

methods.name: CreateLinearManager
methods.description:
Create and return a new GridLayoutManager instance, which will allow us to display the RecyclerView as a List layout

**stackFromEnd** will specify whether the RecyclerView is going to take the bottom side as starting.

methods.name: CreateRecycler
methods.description: Create a new component with the default size.

methods.name: CreateStaggeredGridManager
methods.description:
Create and return a new StaggeredGridLayoutManager instance, which will allow us to display the RecyclerView as a Staggered Grid layout

**spanCount:** Number of columns (when it is vertical) or rows (horizontal)

![](https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcRkJPFgdG0k04BwlNwbxfjMHuQt1dJ5w1tjecw4EtwzPY9ssB5PKG4Rz9dgWhAoDSTSWtE&usqp=CAU)

*Unlike the GridLayoutManager, this manager does not necessarily need the items to have the same size, since it can display them depending on their content.*

methods.name: Delete
methods.description: This block allows us to remove the indicated RecyclerView component.

methods.name: GetComponentPosition
methods.description:
Find and return the position (relative to the data list) of a component inside an item in the RecyclerView (when it is running).

**id:** RecyclerView ID

![](https://i.imgur.com/NzLe0Sn.png)

methods.name: GetRecyclerById
methods.description: Returns the  RecyclerView as component

methods.name: GetViewPosition
methods.description:
Find and return the position (relative to the data list) of a View inside an item in the RecyclerView (when it is running).

**id:** RecyclerView ID

*Similar to 'GetComponentById' but focused on objects of type View*

methods.name: IsCreated
methods.description: Returns if a RecyclerView with the specified id exists.

methods.name: NotifyDataSetChanged
methods.description: Notifies the RecyclerView that the linked list has changed.When notified, the RecyclerView will be visibly updated.

methods.name: NotifyItemChanged
methods.description:
Notifies the RecyclerView that an item in the linked list has changed.When notified, the RecyclerView will visibly update that item (if it is on screen)

> This function is useless when DiffUtil is enabled (because Diffutil is responsible for managing the changes)

methods.name: NotifyItemInserted
methods.description:
Notifies the RecyclerView that an item in the linked list was inserted.

> This function is useless when DiffUtil is enabled (because Diffutil is responsible for managing the changes)

methods.name: NotifyItemRemoved
methods.description:
Notifies the RecyclerView that an item in the linked list was removed. 

> This function is useless when DiffUtil is enabled (because Diffutil is responsible for managing the changes)

methods.name: RootAsComponent
methods.description: Transforms the root into a component (widget) and returns it. This function is useful for working with integrated dynamic components.

methods.name: RootAsContainer
methods.description: Transforms the root into a container(**Arrangement**) and returns it. This function is useful for working with dynamic components.

methods.name: ScrollTo
methods.description: This function will cause the RecyclerView to make a displacement to the indicated position.

methods.name: SetContentComparator
methods.description:
*Only for DiffUtil (Enabled)*
It establishes the procedure in charge of carrying out the task of comparing the content of each item in the list.

**contentComparator**: Procedure Name

> The parameters of the procedure must be the following:
>
> * **id** (ID of the RecyclerView required by the procedure)
> * **oldItem**: Previous item to be compared
> * **newItem**: New item to be compared

The procedure must return a value of type **Boolean**. It should return *'True'* if the comparison is successful and the contents have been found to be **the same**, and *'False'* when the contents have been found to be **completely different**.

#### Example

Let's suppose that the Data list is linked to a RecyclerView with DiffUtil activated, when it requires it, it will compare the contents of each item in the list to know if it is going to update that item visibly or not.
The comparison can be made according to the data and how the developer wants it to be evaluated... as the philosophy dictates in the extension, it is the developer who decides.

![](data:image/png;base64,)

methods.name: SetHasFixedSize
methods.description:
Specifies whether the size of the RecyclerView is *dependent* on the size of each item.
With FixedSize enabled, we tell it that all items are the same size and therefore the size (width or height) of the RecyclerView will not be affected.
This feature is not mandatory but using it will improve the fluidity of the widget.

Fixed Items Height

![](https://enoent.fr/images/articles/recyclerview-basics/pngs_recyclerview-active.png)

methods.name: SetItemComparator
methods.description:
*Only for DiffUtil (Enabled)*

*Unlike ContentComparator, the RecyclerView already has an ItemComparator implementation so it doesn't need to be set.*


It establishes the procedure in charge of carrying out the task of comparing ***each item*** in the list.

**itemComparator**: Procedure Name

> The parameters of the procedure must be the following:
>
> * **id** (ID of the RecyclerView required by the procedure)
> * **oldItem**: Previous item to be compared
> * **newItem**: New item to be compared

The procedure must return a value of type **Boolean**. It should return *'True'* if the comparison is successful and the items are **the same**, and *'False'* when the items have been found to be **completely different**.

#### Example

Let's suppose that the Data list is linked to a RecyclerView with DiffUtil activated, when it requires it, it will compare each item in the list to know if it is going to update that item visibly or not.


![](data:image/png;base64,)

methods.name: SetLayoutManager
methods.description: Changes the layout manager of the RecyclerView.

methods.name: SetScrollChangedListener
methods.description:
Set a procedure that will be notified of the RecyclerView's scroll change.

**scrollChangedListener:** procedure name

> The parameters of the procedure must be the following:
>
> * **id** (ID of the RecyclerView required by the procedure)
> * **x**: The displacement in the X axis (horizontal)
> * **y**: The displacement in the Y axis (vertical)

*Example of how to know how much vertical scrolling was done in the RecyclerView.*

![](data:image/png;base64,)

methods.name: SetScrollStateListener
methods.description:
Sets a procedure that will be evaluated each time the RecyclerView's scroll state changes.

**scrollStateListener:** procedure name

> The parameters of the procedure must be the following:
>
> * **id** (ID of the RecyclerView required by the procedure)
> * **state** Current Scrolling state
>
> Scrolling has three states: **idle**, **settling** and **dragging**

*Example of how to know how much vertical scrolling was done in the RecyclerView.*

extensions.name: Fancy RecyclerView 2
extensions.description: Based on the Android RecyclerView widget. This extension adds many functionalities of the RecyclerView for Kodular.

events.name: OnWidgetClicked
events.description: Event generated when any widget is clicked.For this event to be fired by a widget, it must have the respective property,"Clickable".

events.name: OnWidgetLongClicked
events.description: Event generated when any widget is long clicked.For this event to be fired by a widget, it must have the respective property,"Clickable".

events.name: OnBindingRequest
events.description: Event launched when a group changes its position and needs to update its widgets.

events.name: OnBindingCustomView
events.description: Event fired when the custom widget that is optionally configured in the RecyclerView is visible on the screen or needs to be updated.

events.name: FastScrolled
events.description: Event launched when the "Listenable Scroll" method finished and the group being navigated to is already visible on the screen.

events.name: ItemSwiped
events.description: Event launched when a group triggers a swipe action.Indicates whether the action corresponds to the right or left side.

events.name: MultiSelectionOptionSelected
events.description: Event triggered when an option is selected in multiple selection mode.

methods.name: AddSelectionIconOption
methods.description:
Adds options with icons to the multi-selection bar.
**Info:**
>These options will be added to the selection bar.
>The icon is the name of a file in assets or the path to an image file.

methods.name: AddSelectionOption
methods.description:
Adds options to the multi-selection bar.
**Info:**
>An option to select all items can be set with the SelectAllTitle property.

methods.name: Build
methods.description:
Finishes with the recyclerview configuration and adds it inside the specified component.
**Info:**
>It is preferable not to add it inside a Scroll Arrangement, but it can be added inside a Swipe Refresh Layout or other arrangement.

methods.name: GetCurrentScrollPixels
methods.description: Returns the offset position the recyclerview is currently in, the value is returned in pixels.

methods.name: GetGroupForPosition
methods.description:
Returns the group corresponding to an adapter position (linked to the number of items in the data list). It will only return a valid position if the corresponding group is visible on the screen.
**Info:**
>It should be used when we are sure that the item corresponding to the position is visible on the screen, for example after using the ListenableScroll method.

methods.name: GetLastSyncedWidget
methods.description:
Returns the last widget synced with the RecyclerView.
**Info:**
>The returned widget cannot be edited with the Kodular blocks, but it does allow it to be used with extensions such as the Widget Animator or widget Screenshot.

methods.name: GetRootName
methods.description:
Returns a name that is used to identify the first widget to be added to the RecyclerView model.
**Info:**
>This block tells the RecyclerView that it is starting to create the model.

methods.name: GetScrollRangePixels
methods.description: Returns the maximum scroll position of the RecyclerView. It is returned in pixels.

methods.name: ListenableScrollTo
methods.description: Causes the RecyclerView to go to a certain position and calls the FastScroll event when it is done scrolling.

methods.name: NotifyDataSetChanged
methods.description: Notifies the recyclerview that a change occurred in the data list, because of this, it will have to update the widgets.

methods.name: ScrollTo
methods.description: Causes the RecyclerView to scroll to the specified position. It does not notify when it is done.

methods.name: SetCustomView
methods.description: Sets the component that will be displayed among the RecyclerView items.

methods.name: SetGridManager
methods.description: Sets the layout manager to Grid, so that the items in the RecyclerView will be displayed with columns or rows, depending on the orientation.

methods.name: SetListManager
methods.description: Sets the layout manager to List, so the items in the RecyclerView will be listed horizontally or vertically depending on the orientation.

methods.name: SetScrollListener
methods.description:
It establishes the procedure that is responsible for listening to the changes of state when scrolling in the RecyclerView.
**Info:**
>The addresses are automatically detected depending on the layout manager.
>In a horizontal manager the procedure should have the following parameters: [canScrollToLeft, canScrollToRight, isIddle]
>In a vertical manager they should be: [canScrollToTop, canScrollToBottom, isIddle]
>The isIddle parameter refers to whether the RecyclerView is idle.

methods.name: SetStaggeredGridManager
methods.description: Sets the layout manager as a staggered grid. It will be displayed in columns or rows depending on the orientation.

methods.name: SetSwipeForViewTypes
methods.description:
It establishes in which direction or in which directions each type of view can be scrolled.
**Info:**
>The letters l, r, and b are used to indicate the left, right, and both sides respectively.
>Rules structure:
[view-type]:[side]
Example:"4: l, 5: r, 6: b"

methods.name: SetViewTypeProvider
methods.description:
It establishes the procedure that is in charge of returning the type of view according to the position that the RecyclerView returns.
**Info:**
>The procedure must have the parameters [position, listItem]
>It must return a type of view, it must be one created previously.

methods.name: SmoothScrollTo
methods.description:
Causes the RecyclerView to scroll smoothly to a specific position.
**Info:**
>It does not notify any event if it finished with its task.

methods.name: Sync
methods.description: It is mainly used when configuring the RecyclerView for the first time, it tells all the components that depend on it that this RecyclerView is currently being worked on.

methods.name: SyncWidget
methods.description: Synchronizes a widget with the RecyclerView. It is mainly used to edit the widgets.

methods.name: SyncWithViewType
methods.description: Synchronizes the RecyclerView and also introduce a new type of view in it.

methods.name: UpdateData
methods.description: Changes the data list bound to the RecyclerView, notifies you that it should be redrawn according to the new list.

methods.name: UpdateVisibleItem
methods.description: Notifies the RecyclerView that it has to redraw an item regardless of whether the linked list underwent a change.

properties.name: DividerColor
properties.description:
Sets the color of the division between the groups.
**Block Types:** *Write*
**Presentation:** *Designer, Blocks*

properties.name: DividerSize
properties.description:
Sets the height/width of the division between the groups.
**Block Types:** *Write*
**Presentation:** *Designer, Blocks*

properties.name: CustomView
properties.description:
Sets whether the RecyclerView will show a component among its groups.
**Block Types:** *Write*
**Presentation:** *Designer, Blocks*

properties.name: CustomViewItemsOffset
properties.description:
Sets the number of items to be displayed before displaying the set component.
**Block Types:** *Write*
**Presentation:** *Designer, Blocks*

properties.name: MultiSelection
properties.description:
Sets whether multi-selection is enabled.
**Block Types:** *Write*
**Presentation:** *Designer, Blocks*

properties.name: MultiSelectionSuffix
properties.description:
Sets the text that will be displayed after the number of items selected in the selection bar.
**Block Types:** *Write*
**Presentation:** *Designer, Blocks*

properties.name: SelectAllTitle
properties.description:
Sets the title of the option button to make a selection of all items.
**Block Types:** *Write*
**Presentation:** *Designer, Blocks*

properties.name: MultiSelectionOpacity
properties.description:
Sets the opacity of the group when it is selected.
**Block Types:** *Write*
**Presentation:** *Designer, Blocks*
**Info:**
>Values range from 0.0 to 1.0

properties.name: MultiSelectionColor
properties.description:
Sets the background color of the group when selected.
**Block Types:** *Write*
**Presentation:** *Designer, Blocks*

properties.name: SwipeActions
properties.description:
Specifies whether swipe actions will be available to the RecyclerView.
**Block Types:** *Write*
**Presentation:** *Designer, Blocks*

properties.name: SwipeDirection
properties.description:
Specify the available sides to trigger swipe actions. "Left, Right and Both".
**Block Types:** *Write*
**Presentation:** *Designer*
**Info:**
>Sides can be specified for each view type with the "SetSwipeForViewTypes" method.

properties.name: SwipeThreshold
properties.description:
The fraction that the user should move the group to be considered as swiped.
**Block Types:** *Write*
**Presentation:** *Designer, Blocks*
**Info:**
>Values range from 0.0 to 1.0
>The fraction is calculated with respect to RecyclerView's bounds.

properties.name: SwipeVelocityThreshold
properties.description:
Defines the maximum velocity ItemTouchHelper will ever calculate for pointer movements.
**Block Types:** *Write*
**Presentation:** *Designer, Blocks*
**Info:**
>Values range from 0.0 to 1.0.
>If you increase the value, it will be easier for the user to swipe diagonally and if you decrease the value, user will need to make a rather straight finger movement to trigger a swipe.

properties.name: SwipeLeftSideColor
properties.description:
Specifies the background color of the action on the left side.
**Block Types:** *Write*
**Presentation:** *Designer*

properties.name: SwipeRightSideColor
properties.description:
Specifies the background color of the action on the right side.
**Block Types:** *Write*
**Presentation:** *Designer*

properties.name: SwipeLeftRevealColor
properties.description:
Specifies the color of the wave that indicates that the action on the left side is considered to be launched.
**Block Types:** *Write*
**Presentation:** *Designer*

properties.name: SwipeRightRevealColor
properties.description:
Specifies the color of the wave that indicates that the action on the right side is considered to be launched.
**Block Types:** *Write*
**Presentation:** *Designer*

properties.name: SwipeLeftSideIcon
properties.description:
Specifies the image file name that the RecyclerView will display in the action on the left side.
**Block Types:** *Write*
**Presentation:** *Designer, Blocks*
**Info:**
>The file must be located in the assets of the project. Only the name plus the extension should be entered.
>If the image is too large it will be resized.

properties.name: SwipeRightSideIcon
properties.description:
Specifies the image file name that the RecyclerView will display in the action on the right side.
**Block Types:** *Write*
**Presentation:** *Designer, Blocks*

properties.name: Visible
properties.description:
Specifies RecyclerView visibility.
**Block Types:** *Write*
**Presentation:** *Designer, Blocks*

properties.name: FixedSize
properties.description:
Specifies whether the RecyclerView will have a fixed size.
**Block Types:** *Write*
**Presentation:** *Designer, Blocks*
**Info:**
>If enabled, the size of the RecyclerView does not depend on its children. This means that it does not have to be constantly resized, thus preventing performance variations.

properties.name: BackgroundColor
properties.description:
Sets the background color of the RecyclerView.
**Block Types:** *Write*
**Presentation:** *Designer, Blocks*

properties.name: BackgroundAsset
properties.description:
Sets the background image of the RecyclerView.
**Block Types:** *Write*
**Presentation:** *Designer, Blocks*
**Info:**
>The file must be located in the assets of the project. Only the name plus the extension should be entered.

properties.name: Width
properties.description:
Sets the width of the RecyclerView.
**Block Types:** *Write*
**Presentation:** *Designer, Blocks*
**Info:**
>Allowed values are Automatic and FillParent
>To specify a different size, change it in the component where the RecyclerView will be created.

properties.name: Height
properties.description:
Sets the height of the RecyclerView.
**Block Types:** *Write*
**Presentation:** *Designer, Blocks*
**Info:**
>Allowed values are Automatic and FillParent
>To specify a different size, change it in the component where the RecyclerView will be created.

extensions.shortDescription: Based on the Android RecyclerView widget. This extension adds many functionalities of the RecyclerView for Kodular.

events.name: OnItemChanged
events.description: Event fired every time the focused item on the carousel changes.

events.name: ItemClicked
events.description: Event fired every time an Item is clicked.

methods.description: Adds the Image Carousel to the screen and initializes it with the indicated list.
methods.name: Build

methods.description:
Notifies Carousel that the list it was initialized with has changed (items were added or removed).

> If the list is a global variable, it is preferable to always work on that same list, that is, modify it by adding or removing items, but not by replacing the value of the variable with a new list.
methods.name: NotifyDataUpdate
Stop
methods.description: For an Image Carousel with the 'AutoPlay' option, this block pauses the automatic switching of images.

methods.name: Play
methods.description: For an Image Carousel with the 'AutoPlay' option, this block resumes the automatic switching of images.

methods.name: IsPlaying
methods.description:
For an Image Carousel with the 'AutoPlay' option, this block returns true or false depending on the state of the autoplay.

> Useful for working with 'Play' and 'Stop' blocks

methods.name: Next
methods.description: This block changes the focused item to the next one, by smooth scrolling to the next position.

methods.name: Previous
methods.description: This block changes the focused item to the previous one, by smooth scrolling to the previous position.

methods.name: GoToPosition
methods.description: This block changes the focused item to the item at the indicated position, if the **smooth** option is *True* then it will perform a smooth (animated) scroll to the position, if *False* then it will quickly change without any animation.

methods.name: ImageWidthByCount
methods.description:
This block calculates a width for each image, depending on the size of the **container** (where the Carousel is located) and the number of items you want to display.

> **Offset**: It is an extra size that will be added to the calculated result.
> Leave it at 0 if it is to be ignored.

methods.name: ImageWidthByPercent
methods.description: This block calculates a width for each image, depending on the size of the **container** (where the Carousel is located) and a **percentage** (relative to the container.)

properties.name: Width
properties.description: Sets the width of the Carousel.

properties.name: Height
properties.description: Sets the height of the Carousel.

properties.name: ErrorImage
properties.description: Sets an **image** to be displayed when it is impossible to get the image from a server or when any other error occurs.

properties.name: LoadingImage
properties.description: Sets an **image** to be displayed while the actual image is loading in the Carousel Item.

properties.name: ImageHeight
properties.description: Sets the height of each Carousel Item

properties.name: ImageWidth
properties.description: Sets the width of each Carousel Item

properties.name: ImageRadius
properties.description: Sets the corner radius of each Carousel Item

properties.name: ImageElevation
properties.description: Sets the elevation of each Carousel Item
Sets the **margin** of each carousel item on the corresponding ***side***
properties.name: Margin[Side]
Offset
properties.description:
Sets an additional offset space to display at the start and end of the carousel.

> Leave at 0 if no space is required to be displayed

properties.name: ImageScaling
properties.description:
Sets the scaling ratio of the image (the picture file).

> It is quite useful to prevent performance problems with very large images.
>
> Values ​​range from **0... to 1**

properties.name: AnimationScale
properties.description:
In carousels with the *ChangeAnimation* property activated, with the help of this property it is possible to specify to what size items that are not in focus are to be scaled.

> Values ​​range from 0... to 1 where 1 is the actual size without scaling.

properties.name: ImageBackgroundColor
properties.description: This property sets the background color of each item.

properties.name: Endless
properties.description: This property sets whether the carousel will end depending on the list of data. If it is activated, then the items will be repeated over and over again cyclically.

properties.name: CenterCrop
properties.description:
This property is focused on the mechanism to load the images in each item. 

> If enabled, the image will be centered and cropped to fit each item perfectly.
>
> If disabled, the image will fit the size of the item without cropping it.

properties.name: ChangeAnimation
properties.description:
If enabled, the carousel will produce an animation each time a scroll occurs or the focused item changes.
The animation consists of scaling the unfocused items to a smaller size (depending on the value of '*AnimationScale*') and scale the focused item to its actual size.

properties.name: LinearSnap
properties.description:
By default, the carousel has a pager-like scrolling behavior. With this property, we can change that behavior.

> If on, switches to snap swipe behavior.

properties.name: AutoPlay
properties.description:
This property specifies whether the carousel changes to the next item automatically.

> The interval is set with the '*PlayDelay*' property

properties.name: PlayDelay
properties.description:
This property specifies the time interval in which an automatic change in the carousel will occur.

> Its value is in milliseconds.

extensions.name: LinearMetrics
extensions.description: It allows to model an object that specifies the measurements for widgets whose parents are ZLinear Widgets.

methods.name: BuildProps
methods.description: Returns a new property set containing the previously defined properties.

methods.name: SetBuildInMetrics
methods.description: Changes the measurements configured in the widget.

properties.name: MarginLeft
properties.description:
Specifies the extra space on the left side of the widget.
**Block Types:** *Write*
**Presentation:** *Blocks*

properties.name: MarginRight
properties.description:
Specifies the extra space on the right side of the widget.
**Block Types:** *Write*
**Presentation:** *Blocks*

properties.name: MarginTop
properties.description:
Specifies the extra space on the top side of the widget.
**Block Types:** *Write*
**Presentation:** *Blocks*

properties.name: MarginBottom
properties.description:
Specifies the extra space on the bottom side of the widget.
**Block Types:** *Write*
**Presentation:** *Blocks*

properties.name: Margin
properties.description:
Specifies the extra space for all sides of the widget.
**Block Types:** *Write*
**Presentation:** *Blocks*

dynamic_recyclerview.title: Dynamic Recyclerview
dynamic_recyclerview.description:
This extension allows to integrate the RecyclerView widget to block platforms. It allows the creation of the widget *dynamically* allowing the creation of several instances of it and allows us to manage them quite easily.

The philosophy in the extension is that the developer can handle all the working of the RecyclerView. That is why the main functions are based and depend on the '**procedures**' that are known in the block platforms.

The extension integrates most of the functions provided in the android RecyclerView.

> Visit [RecyclerView  |  Android Developers](https://developer.android.com/reference/androidx/recyclerview/widget/RecyclerView?hl=es-419) for more information

It allows accessing and configuring each of them in a simple and understandable way for the developer. In addition, due to its structure, it allows the integration of different modules in order to improve the operation of the widget.

### Features

* Create RecyclerViews dynamically
* 100% control of the data flow.
* Supports dynamic components
* It manages 100% of the movement, being able to access the status of the movement and its current position.
* It allows the integration of different types of design for specific items, for example, a Chat is very easy to implement due to this feature.
* 100% control in the creation of components. The developer is responsible for creating widgets.
* Support for different Layout Managers, they are responsible for allowing the RecyclerView to be displayed as a list, as a grid, as a ChipGroup and others.
* Due to its structure, it allows integration with other extensions to improve the application.
* In case something is misconfigured in the RecyclerView, the API will take care of showing the common errors that may be happening.

image_carousel.title: Image Carousel
image_carousel.description:
This extension provides a widget that allows you to create a horizontal carousel of images. It has several features, such as automatic playback (switch to next image).
In addition, it includes several interface features that can be edited.

Some features:

* Animation of scaling when changing images.
* Autoplay.
* Image scaling (**Centered** and **Adjusted**).
* Endless mode, the same images will be repeated over and over again.
* Image Caching
image_carousel.shortDescription: Widget that allows you to create a horizontal carousel of images.
